page.title: 06Local History.
page.content: SNODS EDGE ST.JOHNS CHURCH HALL. The Hall was originally the parish school,erected in 1877 by the trustees of Lord Crewe,who are supposed to contribute Â£10p.a.towards its upkeep. It ceased to be a school in 1960 because of a drop in population and it became a parish hall.A number of extensions and improvements have been made to the Hall,organised by the Hall Committee and financed by the support of the parishioners. The Hall is used extensively by the many clubs,societies and sporting organisations in the parish.It has in recent years won the award for "The Best Kept Parish Hall"twice.This award takes into account the condition of the Hall,and the amount of usage and benefit it has to the community.Though it is a Parish Hall,it is in fact a licensed premises.
